channel.title: Packet 120, What do
channel.description:
I've finally got flashing side icons working on my client *yay* but now I want to use the packet that is sent after clicking the flashing icon. That's packet 120. Now, I don't know if it's server to client, or client to server. That shit confuses me. But Packet 24 is what actually makes the tab flash, and 120 is after you click (lol repeated statement.)
How would I got about using this.

item.title: Packet 120, What do
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:4, topic:478033”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=596229.msg4197964#msg4197964 date=1357783389]

Server to client. The server inputs all clicking actions and does the actions that are done after clicking it. The client processes those actions into the graphics.

Thanks for clarifying that much
But I don’t know where to go from there
[/quote]
Send the input via PacketHandler.java.[/quote]
So it’d almost be like how I send the packet to flash the side bar in the first place, but for clicking it.

Oh, and it does stop flashing when I click. I just want to add dialogues and tips and etc to them, if I need to.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet 120, What do
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:478033”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=596229.msg4197963#msg4197963 date=1357783283]
Server to client. The server inputs all clicking actions and does the actions that are done after clicking it. The client processes those actions into the graphics.
[/quote]
Thanks for clarifying that much
But I don’t know where to go from there[/quote]
Send the input via PacketHandler.java.

Read full topic
